title: Potential graph - resistances of X and Y

content.question: The figure shows a circuit comprised of a battery and two resistors, Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. The graph shows the electric potential as a function of position, starting at the point labeled <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>a</mtext></math> and going clockwise around the circuit to the point labeled <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>d</mtext></math>. Which of the following claims about the circuit is correct?

choices.label: Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has a greater resistance than Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has a greater resistance than Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has a greater current than Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has a greater current than Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

content.answer: Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has a greater resistance than Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
